item.title: Man shot dead by police after Glasgow stabbings
item.description: Six people, including a police officer, are being treated in hospital for their injuries after the attack.

item.title: Wembley park murders: PCs 'took selfies next to sisters' dead bodies'
item.description: The mother of two sisters murdered in a London park says the images "dehumanised" her children.

item.title: Coronavirus: US has 'serious problem', says Fauci
item.description: The infection is rampant in 16 states, some of which are now freezing their reopening plans.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM warns over virus rules after beach crowds
item.description: The PM says other countries have had virus spikes after people took "liberties" with distancing rules.

item.title: Facebook to tag harmful posts as boycott widens
item.description: Unilever said it would halt advertising on Facebook and Twitter through the end of the year.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM warns over virus rules and PPE tsar says shortage over
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this evening.

item.title: Shopping centre giant Intu enters administration
item.description: Shopping centres including Trafford and Lakeside will continue to trade under administrators KPMG.

item.title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says 'everything is possible' for his side after title win
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says "everything is possible" for his side if they stay "humble" after completing the club's first title win in 30 years.

item.title: Philonise Floyd: 'It's just a lot of pain right now'
item.description: The brother of George Floyd and the family's lawyer spoke to the BBC about the impact his death has had on the world.

item.title: UN chief 'shocked and disturbed' by video of car sex act in Israel
item.description: A video apparently showing a sex act in a UN-marked vehicle in Israel is under investigation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Second national lockdown not needed - Neil Ferguson
item.description: Prof Neil Ferguson tells the BBC he expects to see a targeted approach to tackling local outbreaks.

item.title: UK weather: Hailstones fall on Leeds and Sheffield
item.description: A Met Office yellow weather warning for thunderstorms and heavy rain remains in place.

item.title: Australia caps toilet roll sales after panic-buying
item.description: Supermarkets impose one or two-pack limits on toilet roll as Covid-19 cases in Victoria spike.

item.title: 'Phone has not stopped ringing' for tourist getaways
item.description: Tourist spots have seen bookings boom after the government gave holidays the go ahead from 4 July.

item.title: Fortnite Movie Nite: Christopher Nolan's hit films screen in-game
item.description: Christopher Nolan's movies play inside Fortnite while his latest film is delayed again.

item.title: Bob Dylan's 39th album Rough And Rowdy Ways makes UK chart history
item.description: At 79, the rock legend is now the oldest artist to reach number one with an album of new material.

item.title: Liverpool FC: Ecstatic fans party on the streets
item.description: Supporters gather at Anfield and throughout the city to celebrate Liverpool's Premier League win.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: Which tennis stars caught coronavirus?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: 'Stop using our pain to attract black consumers'
item.description: Some brands have been accused of jumping on the Black Lives Matter bandwagon just to sell their products.

item.title: How cinemas will reopen after lockdown
item.description: The BBC's Lizo Mzimba looks at how a glut of favourite movies will entice film-lovers back.

item.title: Retired midwife's experiences of racism in Yorkshire
item.description: A retired midwife has spoken out about the racism she faced over five decades in Yorkshire.

item.title: Why is UK recycling being dumped by Turkish roadsides?
item.description: The UK sends more plastic waste to Turkey than to any other country but not all of it reaches recycling plants.

item.title: The moment Liverpool players found out they were champions
item.description: Watch the moment Liverpool players celebrated winning the club's first top-flight title in 30 years.

item.title: RAF Voyager: New £900,000 paintwork for PM's plane completed
item.description: RAF Voyager, which was previously grey, is used by the PM and Royal Family for overseas trips.

item.title: Coronavirus: Tsar says PPE shortage crisis is over
item.description: Lord Deighton admits there were "big problems" up to a month ago getting protective kit to NHS staff.

item.title: Intu collapse: What went wrong for the retail giant?
item.description: The owner of some of the UK's biggest shopping centres had been battling issues for years.

item.title: George Floyd death: What US police officers think of protests
item.description: Some think change needs to come from the top, others say they are doing a tough job and under attack.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's happening in Peru?
item.description: Peru has one of the highest case totals and excess death rates in the world - but why?

item.title: Eurovision: How Ariana Grande's songwriter got involved in Will Ferrell's new movie
item.description: Pop songwriter Savan Kotecha and Swedish singer Molly Sanden are among those who helped make the fictional movie about the Eurovision Song Contest.

item.title: Summer holidays: 'We're not really going anywhere'
item.description: People tell the BBC what they plan to do about their holidays this year amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: What's the best thing to do with unwanted statues?
item.description: What is the best thing to do with unwanted statues - and is it an option to leave a divisive statue standing?

item.title: When working from home is much more than emailing
item.description: Some jobs like animating films need more than just regular internet access and robust Wi-Fi.

item.title: Rethink: 'There has been a renaissance of love for nature,' says author Lucy Jones
item.description: Writer and author Lucy Jones considers how - post lockdown - we can capitalise on our rediscovered love of nature.

item.title: Coronavirus: Tales from the key worker sharp end
item.description: During the pandemic, the UK has relied on an army of low-waged key workers. Their diaries reveal the sacrifices they have made.

item.title: Brentford boost promotion hopes with win over leaders West Brom
item.description: Ollie Watkins scores the only goal as Brentford beat leaders West Brom to hot up the Championship automatic promotion race.

item.title: Saturday's gossip: Man Utd interested in Arsenal midfielder Guendouzi
item.description: Man Utd's Guendouzi interest, Arsenal track Porto's Pereira, Maradona tries to lure Ronaldinho out of retirement, plus more.

item.title: Liverpool: Jurgen Klopp 'absolutely overwhelmed' by Premier League title win
item.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp tells BBC sports editor Dan Roan that he was "completely overwhelmed" when his side were confirmed as Premier League champions.

item.title: Battle of the Brits: Kyle Edmund continues fine form with win over Broady - best shots
item.description: Watch the best shots as Kyle Edmund beats Liam Broady in straight sets at the Battle of the Brits event.

item.title: Liverpool win Premier League: Reds' 30-year wait for top-flight title ends
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look back at the 30 years that have passed since Liverpool's last league title back in 1990 as the Reds are confirmed as Premier League champions.

item.title: Coronavirus: What could local lockdowns look like in England?
item.description: Parts of the country could introduce them if cases of Covid-19 spike, but how might they work?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus: How safe is it to get on a plane?
item.description: Many airlines are starting to resume flying, but they first need to reduce the risks of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are international comparisons difficult?
item.description: Should you be comparing Covid-19 statistics between countries?

item.title: Coronavirus: Who should wear a face mask or face covering?
item.description: Face coverings are compulsory for people using public transport in England.

item.title: Lifting lockdown around the UK: All you need to know
item.description: How will social and work life be different after the easing of some restrictions in England?

item.title: Coronavirus: Which schools are reopening for pupils?
item.description: Which children are going back to school, and what about the rest?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing so you can now meet people and carry out a wide range of activities.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Why are gyms and swimming pools still closed? And other questions
item.description: Questions about support bubbles, and other coronavirus topics

item.title: Coronavirus bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people in England, Northern Ireland and Scotland can form "support bubbles".

item.title: Raised in the UK - barred from university
item.description: Many immigrant teens grow up feeling "British", only to find that they aren't - and cannot legally work or study.

item.title: Paul Whelan: The strange case of the ex-marine jailed for spying in Russia
item.description: How an ex-US marine ended up with a 16-year prison sentence after Russia accused him of spying.
